First, we need to get the ID of the newly created Event. Let's use the response from the previous request:      import requests  url = "http://webserver/event/" data = {     "name": "Spectacular Show",     "description": "A show like no other" } response = requests.post(url, json=data) if response.status_code == 201:     event_id = response.json()["data"]["id"] else:     print("Error creating event:", response.text)      Now that we have the ID of the Event, let's create 10 performances for this event. We'll use the schema context to generate the request data.   Here's an example of how you can create a Performance:      url = f"http://webserver/event/{event_id}/performance/" data = {     "startDate": "tomorrow",     "startTime": "10:00 AM" }  # Create 10 performances for this event performances = [] for i in range(10):     if i == 0:         end_date = "today"         end_time = "6:00 PM"     elif i == 1:         end_date = "tomorrow"         end_time = "8:00 PM"     elif i == 2:         end_date = "tomorrow"         end_time = "10:00 PM"     elif i == 3:         end_date = "day after tomorrow"         end_time = "6:00 PM"     elif i == 4:         end_date = "day after tomorrow"         end_time = "8:00 PM"     elif i == 5:         end_date = "day after tomorrow"         end_time = "10:00 PM"     elif i == 6:         end_date = "day after tomorrow"         end_time = "11:59 PM"     elif i == 7:         end_date = "day after tomorrow"         end_time = "12:59 AM"     elif i == 8:         end_date = "day after tomorrow"         end_time = "1:59 AM"     elif i == 9:         end_date = "day after tomorrow"         end_time = "2:59 AM"      performances.append({         "startDate": f"{end_date}",         "startTime": f"{end_time}" }) for perf in performances:     response = requests.post(url, json=perf) if response.status_code == 201:         print("Performance created successfully!") else:         print("Error creating performance:", response.text)
